name: Doubletree by Hilton Hotel London - Westminster

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Spent a few days over the Christmas period at the City Inn for a family Xmas getaway. We were very pleased with the location, being almost on the South bank of the Thames and within easy walking distance of Westminster, Buckingham Palace, Horseguards etc. This was very useful as no/very little public transport on Xmas & Boxing Days. Hotel was smart, bright and modern with not an Xmas decoration in sight unless you count the Rubics cube Xmax Tree. This is not a critisism by the way.
reviews.title: Christmas at the City Inn

likes.disliked: — Lack of availability of room service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The room was a reasonable size , comfortable and well appointed. Good shower room and facilities. Reception staff and concierge were helpful and attentive.
reviews.title: A little gem hidden behind the Tate!

likes.disliked: — the room was quite dark, despite a large window

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The negatives were room service which was advertised as 24 hour; two evenings in a row room service did not respond or were unavailable. On one evening we were were promised a call back from room service by reception only to receive a brief call from someone who said his phone wasn't working and he'd call back. He didn't! This was not satisfactory as one of our party was too ill to go to the dining room....so no dinner...twice.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

likes.liked: — soft beds, nice room service, decent location, cool computer/tv in room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked Xmas lunch in the dining room which was quite pricey @ £71.50 per head (incl compulsory service charge). Xmas lunch was few frills and quite disappointing and practically the same menu was on offer the night before at £24.95 plus service. As a plus though, Santa did come with gratis gifts for the children, which was a nice touch.
reviews.title: Beautiful New Years Eve Break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We only tried to have breakfast in the dining room once....we were asked to wait about 15 mins for a table although there were many onoccupied at the time.....so we went out, across Lambeth Bridge and found a decent little caff cum river cruise office that did a full English for £5.95. Bargain!
reviews.title: A Hidden Gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel recently and I thought it was very good. It is in a quiet area about 5 minutes walk from Pimlico tube station.
reviews.title: What a find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The lobby area is very impressive and stylish and the rooms are small but very well laid out.
reviews.title: Loved the City Inn, Westminster

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The imac in the room is an excellent touch and can be used for internet/tv/radio/DVD/CD
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel - great bar!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The two italian lads in the bar are both very friendly and you can have a bit of footy banter with them (one is a Napoli fan the other AC Milan)
reviews.title: An IKEA hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall this is a gereat alternative to the overpriced understyled hotels of the west end and although it is a tube ride to the majority of attractions, it is more than worth it.
reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008
reviews.text: We held our wedding reception at City Inn Hotel Westminster and most of our guests stayed there. What a fantastic hotel, they made our wedding day everything we wanted it to be and more. We got married in Westminster register office and all met at the hotel first, my self and my partner had been upgraded to a suit as the bride and groom, what a lovely surprise and what a fantastic room, overlooking the London Eye and parliment we had a great view across London. The suites are very roomy with a large L shaped sofa, table and chairs, large bedroom and very large bathroom. The other guests stayed in City rooms which were also very nice indeed and what fantastic value for money. If anyone wants a great hotel, great location, with a great bar for very reasonable prices for central London then stay at the City Inn. If you want a wedding in central London as we did then the hotel was such a great choice. Of course we wanted our wedding day to be a day to remember and for us and all our guests and we certainly did, the food was excellent as was the service and the view we had from the Sky lounge where we had pre dinner drinks was breath taking, seeing all London lit up in front of us made for a great way to start the evening. I could not fault the hotel in any way for our wedding nor for the hotel service, I have no hesitation in giving it a 5, I would give it more if I could. Look forward to staying there again just because we liked it so much.
reviews.title: fantastic wedding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked up for a weekend for my girl friend and i over the christmas break. I think the title of this review says it all.
reviews.title: "Really Good Hotel... Great Atmosphere and amazing food!!"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Really great hotel! clean, modern and professional.... and very good value for money - We got two nights for 150.00 GBP... thought it was very reasonable.
reviews.title: Good hotel in a good neighborhood

likes.liked: — Cleanliness, quiet, good neighborhood, quality of breakfast.

reviews.title: Comfortable / Stylish / Friendly and great value
reviews.text: One night we had dinner at the hotels City Cafe restaurant... Although expenisve, definatly worth it... amazing food, good wine and great service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Located just round the corner of westminster, great location to go and see some sights.
reviews.title: excellant stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: My 6th trip there and on all points it remains an efficient, well run property. Tourists used to American hotels might complain about the size of the bathroom or narrow windows are not used to UK accomodations.
reviews.title: Consistent and excellent

likes.disliked: — If it's raining, the tube seems a long way away and taxis are sometimes hard to find nearby.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a modern, classy, trendy, but generous property. First class restaurant, great bar, good sized rooms, decent health club, and perfect location for tourists. (And a decent location for business travelers, especially if you have meetings spread out around the City, West End, and Chelsea/Knightsbridge.)
reviews.title: Wonderful amenities and service

likes.disliked: — A little far from the tube.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Strongly recommend it - a much better alternative than the traditional "British" property with tiny slow elevators and bad food.
reviews.title: Highly recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for two nights at the City Inn Westminster and loved it. The rooms are really nice with good bathrooms. The service levels are very high. We received good recommendations for dinner from the concierge.
reviews.title: Exceptional!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: It's an easy walk to Westminster Abbey and the London Eye from the hotel. For serious tube travellers it is a little far. It's a good 7 minute walk to the Pimlico tube station.
reviews.title: Excellent Location and Good Price, for London.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: stayed at this hotel 17th Feb
reviews.title: Superb!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: found check in really friendly and they allowed us to check in to our room at 10-30am.
reviews.title: Simply works

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the room itself looks new although I know the hotel is now a few years old. Room was spotless with the IMac providing free internet, Ipod connection, tv, etc.
reviews.title: Cool and not too trendy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: Bathroom has White Company toiletries and bathrobes provided as standard.
reviews.title: Great location and value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel itself is really handy for Westminster and it's nearest tube is Pimlico and is only 1 stop from Victoria coach/tube/train station.
reviews.title: Comfortable Westminster

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here using the Tesco Clubcard Vouchers which worked out at £190 per room per night, which i felt was too expensive for this hotel. This rate included a full english breakfast which we felt was awful. The food wasnt hot enough and also quite greasy - avoid the scrambled egg at all costs! The second day we opted to have just the continential breakfast, which was just ok, but the tea was cold.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, shame about the Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The plus points were the facilities in the room which included: hairdryer, iron, tea making facilities, free internet access with an apple mac pc, free access to room safe. The room was exceptionally clean and the toiletries and bathrobes were a nice touch.
reviews.title: Great value and great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was ok, although the streets were deserted when walking back from the tube station late at night.
reviews.title: Excellent location and value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Overall its an average hotel, for the price we paid I think you would find better in a better location.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: A friend suggested this hotel and after we checkec it out on trip advisor, for the money it sounded great. Well, we're glad we stayed here. It is walking distance to the tube station. Very modern and clean hotel and rooms. There is an apple computer in every room which made it so easy to check emails and look for directions. Walking distance to Westminster Abbey and the Parliament/big ben. Very compfortable bed and pillows. We will stay here again.
reviews.title: Good business hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Just stayed at City Inn for 2 nights. Got a great deal from the City Inn's own website. Paid £95 in a club room, which also included breakfast and free drink each day of stay.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Only problem was reception told me on check in that breakfast wasn't included. I checked the site later and found that it was, on calling reception they apologised and we received a free dinner that evening too. The only other slight gripe is a £4 tray charge for room service.
reviews.title: Best London Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Apart from that, good friendly staff, nice clean and modern hotel. Good location for easy walk to river and Westminster area.
reviews.title: Opaque pricing but still pretty good

likes.disliked: — Housekeeping waking us up early and not taking no for an answer and the poor language skills of some of the -- otherwise friendly -- staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: I've stayed in a huge number of London hotels over the past 2 years and this is by far the best - beating a number of 5 stars. Staff were consistently friendly, rooms were clean, food excellent and great value for money. It's only 3 mins walk from Pimlico tube and unless another 'similar' hotel comes up on TripAdvisor, I wouldn't consider anything else.
reviews.title: London's best value?

likes.liked: — Its modern, light and airy design from the exterior to the foyer and the rooms themselves.
likes.disliked: — No tube station on the doorstep, extras a bit overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: I like CityInns but their pricing has gone crazy. Their rates change daily and the staff are totally inflexible so my tip would be to book a flexible rate (ie one that is cancellable without charge) and wait and see if they offer others nearer the date of your stay as we ended up getting a double 'Club' room with taxes and breakfast (normally GBP 19.50 per person) for GBP 119 per night with 4 drinks vouchers worth GBP 9.75 each thrown in and a late check out till 4 pm (worth at least 25 quid). This was the Summer in the City special.
reviews.title: Very friendly

likes.liked: — The service and overall value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: A clean and quiet hotel located a few blocks south of Westminster Abbey. The rooms are modern and well designed. The beds are comfortable, but not exceptional. If you have an extended stay, there may be a problem with unpacking since there is very limited closet and drawer space. We got a rate of 100 punds per night including a full breakfast which made this hotel a very good value.
reviews.title: Quiet and Clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This fantastic hotel is located a 5min walk down Millbank (Thames Walk) from the Houses of Parliament and Westminster Bridge. After a 'hiccup' on arrival (our Club Room wasn't ready at 3:15pm), we were upgraded to a junior suite (13th floor) - beautiful views over Thames/H of P (St.Paul's Tower) and Westminster Abbey (all floodlit at night).
reviews.title: This is THE place to stay in London

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Hotel was beautifully decorated (minimilist/contemporary yet very comfortable); rooms were immaculate and modern and again comfortable. Bed was highest quality.
reviews.title: Wonderful... as ever!

likes.liked: — The comfortable bed and the food.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: But it was the attention to detail and helpfullness of the staff that rates this hotel. They are great. Professional; customer service oriented to a fault; and friendly.
reviews.title: Great hotel and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The 1st floor lounge was a bit noisy (music) and difficult to talk over. Restaurant on the main floor was beautiful, service was excellent and the food was 5Star. I would however give afternoon tea in the first floor lounge a miss, as it comprised of two scones that were inedible (rock hard), and service was a hit and miss (enthusiastic, but obviously in training). All other meals - breakfast/dinner in restaurant - excellent value.
reviews.title: Very Good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This beautiful hotel isn't in the city center, but does have a great location for exploring Westminster and the area around the Tate. The Pimlico tube station and restaurants are a short walk away. The price was reasonable - especially considering how expensive London hotels can be. The amazing room was well worth the price.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Our twin room was beautiful - spotlessly clean with new fixtures. The imac in the room was our computer, tv and radio - a great amenity. One corner of the room was a small business center with desk, table and two chairs. This was a marvelous place to stay!
reviews.title: Best in London

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: This is my favorite hotel in London, Convenient, stylish, great rooms, great service - a bit pricey but well worth it.
reviews.title: Good Hotel, Good Location in a rubbish city

likes.liked: — Location, close enough to the main sights, but far enough away not to disrupt you
likes.disliked: — Car park and the fact that its in London

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: Overall either for business or pleasure this is highly recommended.
reviews.title: Another good break

likes.liked: — Comfortable room, iMac, great concierge services.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here last weekend as we were seeing a show in the West End. I spent many a happy hour searching for the right London hotel, on a whole they seemed very
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Just back from a weekend at the City Inn Hotel.
reviews.title: Very good hotel

likes.liked: — Breakfast,location, free internet in the room,

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel is very well located, closer to subway stations than expected. The area is really nice and quiet.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008
reviews.text: The rooms were big enough , new and clean, but the bathroom is too small for a 4 star hotel. 2 people can not stay there at the same time.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was included in a wonderful price (we got a spetial autumn preview rate) and it was one of the best I´ve ever seen.
reviews.title: This is a great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Definitely I´ll go back there in my next trip to London.
reviews.title: A good stay, could have been better though

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was a great hotel. The lobby and room was very modern and clean. You had internet access 247 which was nice and the staff was very helpful. They allowed us late check out the next day and room service was great. It was a little far from the St. Pancras Station but you can walk to Buckingham Palace. Make sure you take the double decker tour bus, its worth it!!
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: Clean, modern, good service and great location (a few minutes walk to the Parliament House and Westminster Abbey, right next to Tate Britain and close to the Pimlico tube station). Breakfast was good but if you find it too expensive, you can go to the bakery a few steps away. Ask the reception desk for directions.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: It was quiet at night though. Ask reception which bus to catch from the Victoria tube station or Westminster tube station if the Pimlico line is down again. It was when I was there.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.disliked: — A bit of a walk to the nearest tube station

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I have just returned from a trip to London to celebrate mine and my friends birthdays. The hotel was great, it is modern, clean and the staff are extremely helpful and friendly. As an ex travel agent i am extremely fussy about where i stay and i was not disappointed with this hotel and will definetely be recommending it to my friends and work colleagues.
reviews.title: lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only down side to the trip was the closure of some of the tube lines which meant the nearest underground station of Pimlico on the Victoria line (a 5 mins walk from the hotel) was closed for the weekend and we had to walk up to Westminster station which was a good 10 - 15 mins walk away - further to walk with your suitcases and shopping bags!! The tube closure was obviously not the hotels fault but was a bit annoying.
reviews.title: Excellent London hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: I found the City Inn Westminster a very efficient hotel which has everything a (business) traveler needs. The staff is very friendly (for example, I was quite early for check-in, the receptionist told me that she could give me a room but not a room on a high floor - for that I had to wait a bit).
reviews.title: Efficient and friendly (but a bit boring)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beds are clean and very good, you have a Mac on your room to watch TV, listen music and access the internet. Besides that you have (free) Wifi as well.
reviews.title: Our first choice always when staying in London

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I ordered breakfast in my room, which was delivered on time every day - containing bread, confiture, yogurt and a fruit salad, and with reasonable pricing.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel all round

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located in a quiet street, but with a 5 minute walk you are at Westminster. Closest tube station is Pimlico or Westminster both about 10 min walk.
reviews.title: Pleasant Surprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only 'negative' thing about this hotel is that it is a bit boring (outside looks like an office) - but still recommend this hotel (and definitely will come back!)
reviews.title: Great value for a 4 Star!
Great Hotel!!!
reviews.text: This is a fantastic hotel and I recommend the City Inn to everyone I know. So far no one has been let down by them. The rooms are great and the location is brilliant.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed on the 13th floor in one of the suites which we managed to get at a reduced rate (even at full price these are great value with stunning view and plenty of space)
reviews.title: Great Autumn break

likes.liked: — Friendly staff, large rooms, the view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Plenty of staff on reception, friendly and helpful
reviews.title: So good ive returned several times!

likes.disliked: — Cant think of anything negative really - maybe the cocktail prices?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had no problems with complimentary champagne although the bar it is served in does get very busy
reviews.title: they always fall down in the same area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: The breakfast is excellent and much better than a buffet - wide choice of items (we had to have buffet brekfast the following day due to a fire alarm causing some technical problems in the kitchen)
reviews.title: Best hotel I have ever tried in London

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: That is a really nice hotel in the center of London! Excellent location, nice rooms, free internet access, nice bathroom with good selection of shower gel and washing liquids from the White Company. Even if it is located very close to Westminster it is very quiet and we always could sleep very well there. If you don't want to get out one evening you can rent DVDs from the service desk which is a nice option. We didn't have breakfast but tea and coffee making facilities are available in the room. That is very convenient!
reviews.title: Great Hotel to explore London!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed there already a few times, once we had the continental breakfast included which was also very nice. However, you can find lots of restaurants, pubs etc. where you get the breakfast probably much cheaper.
reviews.title: Extremely Recommended, Best Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: But overall, the cleaniness and the quietness make this hotel an ideal location to explore London.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel in a good location for sight seeing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed in this hotel for 8 nights during my last trip to London and couldn't had been happier with our choice.
reviews.title: Small rooms but great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Location --The hotel has a great location and is in a quiet street.
reviews.title: great, couldn't fault it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: I have stayed here many times. The location is ideal for me, out of tourist area and nice and relaxing.
reviews.title: Rooms still high standard - what happened to the £19 breakfast ?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are of a very high standard, the new imac TV/computer/DVD combo a nice addition from my last stay.
reviews.title: decent value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: What happened to the freshly cooked English breakfast ? I could tell it had been hanging around for a while before I got it. At nearly £20 a go, I expected freshly cooked and not made up from a heap of already cooked items behind the scenes.
reviews.title: Great rooms, shame about the food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: The free wi-fi was nothing but a pain. Gone more than it was there when I wanted it. I did not want to use the in room imac as I have a load of templates on my laptop for my business and I do not appreciate having to retype them when I cannot get my laptop onto the wifi. I resorted to going the nearest McDonalds to get their wifi on many occasions as it was always available.
reviews.title: Third visit to this lovely hotel - excellent as always

likes.disliked: — no spa although there is a beauty salon near pimlico station

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: You are losing your edge. Sort out the breakfast and your wifi.
reviews.title: Easter in London

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are just back from a 3 night stay in the City Inn - over the Easter weekend. I must agree with a lot of others regarding their positive reviews of this hotel.
reviews.title: Great Hotel and Value for Money

likes.liked: — Staff very pleasant, rooms had everything you would need

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had breakfast in the hotel each morning - if you are having the full english you order at the table and they serve it up to you - huge choice, bacon, sausage, eggs, mushrooms etc. You can also serve yourself from the buffet which had yogurts, cold meats, cheese, rolls, cakes, fresh fruit etc - plenty options and we had no complaints. Some people have said that there are long delays for breakfast - we were down every morning about 8 and had no problem. To be fair the hotel did have a little note in the room adivsing that at the weekend breakfast was busy after nine so if you were on a tight schedule then perhaps come before that time. We did not see too many places around where you could have got breakfast.
reviews.title: Great value for London

likes.liked: — Bright and modern accommodation, efficient service and great breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are clean and have everything you would need - tv, tea and coffee making facilities ( complementary milk in the mimi bar fridge), proper hairdryer, safe, mini bar. Bathrooms are as previously described - I agree they are small but they have everything you would want and the shower is very good.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: If you need the use of a computer to check in online or anything then there are facilities on the fourth floor just next to the lift
reviews.title: Good Value for London

likes.disliked: — small room and poor attention to detail by staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There were newspapers available in reception all day and also as you went into breakfast.
reviews.title: Amazing value for money

likes.liked: — Fantastic rooms, great value for money
likes.disliked: — Location - but this was only a minor issue

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Had a Autumn Weekend break as per website, one adult and one child, this inlcudes free english and continental breakfast, complimentary newspapers and glass of champers on first night arrival. in Millbank lounge.
reviews.title: Disappointed

likes.disliked: — staff in restaurant and lounge bar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Had to ask for this and was made to feel most guest do not ask.
reviews.title: Great London Hotel

likes.liked: — The rooms are spacious and immaculate!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: City Inn restaurant, our waiter was very condescending and impatient with my son, it was a Saturday night and early, the restaurant was not that busy. He wanted to take the plate away before I'd finished and kept asking what room number we were staying in. Wether it's because they are not used to a single parent and child who is very well behaved staying in this class of hotel I'm not sure.
reviews.title: Loved this place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On checking out they tried to charge full rate and £17.50 ea for breakfast and newspapers. I had to point out that I'd booked the Autumn weekend break which included both of the above, to which they finally agreed.
reviews.title: Nice Splurge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I will say that this hotel was very clean, well presented if a little formal, the food was of a high standard and facilities excellent.
reviews.title: Smiling Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed one night here and was delighted. Booked on a discount website and got a great rate for a club room including full breakfast (otherwise £17.50), newspaper, fruit plate, mineral water and vouchers for drinks up to £9 each. Early check-in and check-out by 4 p.m. All staff were polite and professional. Room was modern and well appointed, (usual stuff plus Hi-fi, DVD player, iron etc.) and larger seating area than the standard room my son and girlfriend had. Small bathroom was spotless with good walk-in shower, White Company toiletries and comfy bathrobes and towels. Despite high floor, our dual aspect window only offered glimpses of London landmarks above the adjacent office blocks. Bonus at weekends is that free parking is allowed on streets by hotel and we were able to park right opposite hotel entrance. Short walk to Pimlico tube station and even shorter walk to Embankment, Tate Britain and not much further to Westminster Abbey - could not fault location. Very nice bar with lovely seating which served great cocktails (and coffee). Queue for a table at breakfast was efficiently processed by staff and food was delicious. Would definitely recommend and stay again.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel in great location

likes.liked: — Very satisfied with all aspects of this hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here in January for a little get away and really enjoyed it. The Winter deal was good value considering it is up town, also with a nice breakfast included. ( and a glass of champagne in the bar between 6-8pm) The rooms are quite small but very nice and tidy. They also have a service in the lobby which allowes you to borrow a dvd or some music for your stay, with decent enough choice.
reviews.title: Clean and tidy, recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: As I say, for those wishing to visit London for the weekend, this would be a great choice.
reviews.title: impressed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: The only negatives were the bar prices, not too over the top but a bit expensive. Not sure what the lunch/dinner is like as we ate out. Also if you are down here for the weekend, or a tourist, it is a little bit out of the way, but only a short walk to the underground. They also have many cabs waiting outside.
reviews.title: Great friendly hotel

likes.liked: — Well equipped clean comfortable rooms, good food, very helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: All in all a very good stay
reviews.title: Small room with a big punch!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at The City Inn Westminster for New Years Eve 2009. Just a few minutes walk to Lambeth Bridge where you get a good view of the fireworks.
reviews.title: Fantastic - Best in London

likes.liked: — The Comfort of the Rooms & Great Location
likes.disliked: — The view of the office block opposite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We arrived by tube and the hotel is just a short 5 -10 minute walk from Pimlico Tube Station. Follow the signs for the Tate Gallery and it a stones throw from there. Really easy to find.
reviews.title: Excellent modern hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was impressed by the comfort of the beds, cosy duvet and pillows - always a nice surprise. For London the rooms are a really good size. The heating/air conditioning is really easy to operate and you can get the comfort of your room just right.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I also loved the TV being an Apple Mac monitor with free internet access & sky channels. You can also play your CD's though this and they have a FREE DVD library in reception.
reviews.title: Brilliant!

likes.liked: — The steak and chips and the modern decor.

reviews.title: Would definitely go back
reviews.text: The hotel has a great location, yet is very quiet even though it was full when we stayed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: It may be because I'm from the U.S. and the dollar is weak, but the hotel seemed a little expensive to me for what you get.
reviews.title: Good Hotel, Not Great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The size of the bedroom was about what I expected, based on the location and the price, and it was well organized. The bathroom was very small. The bed was cheap and not particularly comfortable. Otherwise the furnishings were modern and in good condition.
reviews.title: Fantastic in every respect

likes.liked: — Spacious, styling was beautiful and comtemporary

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Service in the hotel was above average -- everyone was quite helpful.
reviews.title: Pretty good for the price

likes.disliked: — Lack of activity in the area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: By European or British standards, the breakfast in the hotel was good but expensive. I ate dinner once and thought it was mediocre and overpriced.
reviews.title: Fantstic location and hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I probably wouldn't stay here again, largely because of the location. It wasn't convenient to where I was working, and the 10-15 minute walk to the Pimlico station got a little tiring.
reviews.title: Oozes ambience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel probably deserves the good reviews it gets. Previous posts contains a quite accurate description of the place. I am just goning to make some remarks
reviews.title: Good choice

likes.disliked: — Rooms could a bit larger; and the air heater system was noisy and didn't work properly

reviews.title: Modern, Clean & Great Location
reviews.text: The hotel is not located in the very centre (fortunatly, to my view). Anyway, it is imposible to be near St Paul, The British Museum and Westminster Abbey at the same time. What is true is that this hotel is not in the shopping or nightlife districts, but in a quiet and peacefull area next to the Tate Britain, so if you like Picadilly’s enviroment go somewher else. But if not, probably this hotel is your place. Nevertheless from the place you can get to the Big Ben in about 15 minutes walking.

reviews.title: Modern and Sleek
reviews.text: Note that rhere is little bit of a walk to Pimlico, St James or Westminster tube stations. If you don't carry heavy luggage and like to walk you can reach the hotel from Victoria station in about 20-25 minutes.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: By the way, I suggest to explore the pretty georgian style neiborhood arround St John’s Church in Smith Square.
reviews.title: Good value for tourists
Regular guest
reviews.text: It is also true that there are not many pubs arround the hotel, but there are at least two. The nearest is “Marquis of Granby” which is in Dean Ryle Stree (continuation of John Islip street), 2 minutes walking from the hotel. The other is “The white Swan”, in Vauxhall, in the corner with Causton street. About 5 minutes. Both offer a choice of ales, and british food.

likes.liked: — Nice quiet location, with good transport links
likes.disliked: — A top notch pub next door would be nice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For anyone visiting London and wishing to stay central and worried about being reipped off by overpriced hotels for poor quality and service then this is the answer.
reviews.title: Almost Perfect

likes.liked: — Service and iMac in the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having booked on their own website (which gives rates as competitive as anywhere else) we arrived for the pre-arranged early arrival as requested (our flight landed at 0630 AM) and everything was ready exactly as we had requested. Throughout the whole stay whenever we asked for anything or were promised something it arrived or happened exactly as we wished. All of the staff were excellent throughout.
reviews.title: Excelllent Hotel

likes.liked: — It was very sleek and stylish

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: The room itself although fairly small by some international standards but was clean, tidy, and well equipped. The imac system, plus the wifi for laptops, meant that both my wife and I could use computers or watch TV simultaneously / independantly as we wished. This is the best feature of it's kind I have seen in any hotel especially as it is all included in the room rate.
reviews.title: Always Fabulous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: The matress on the bed was also one of the best we have experienced. We loved it so much we are thinking of buying one of the same brand for home.
reviews.title: Always a pleasure

likes.liked: — Comfortable, reliable, stylish without being pretentious

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast buffet was to the standard expected for this hotel, again with superb service and the bar/lounge on the first floor was a good way to finish off any evening.
reviews.title: Very good experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We first stayed at the City Inn two years ago and had such a great time that we didn't look at any other hotel the next time we came back to London.
reviews.title: Gone downhill in the last 2 years

likes.disliked: — Lack of attention to details like hot food and towels in the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although the front of house staff are amazingly helpful, standards at the hotel have started to slide. We checked in at 4pm and that took over ten minutes for them to find us a room, even though we booked over a month earlier. We were on the Autumn package that offered us free champagne on arrival. That was actually only valid between 6pm and 8pm that evening - no use when we had theatre tickets booked and needed to leave the hotel well in advance of that time.
reviews.title: Great Location near Tate Britain!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On Sunday morning we waited over 15 minutes for breakfast. The hotel was very busy and they had thoughtfully opened up the private dining room on the first floor and put a buffet breakfast on there to contain the overspill. Unfortunately the staff upstairs were not talking to the staff downstairs and it took them far too long to find a table for the two of us, even though downstairs had plenty of space. We both ordered the full English breakfast which arrived promptly. I had to send mine back because everything on the plate was cold. The replacement again arrived quickly and was on a warm plate, but now some of the things had been burnt in order to warm them up. The breakfast on Monday was much better, although it took 20 minutes to arrive, possibly because we avoided the bacon and egg option.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There were other little things that you would not expect to find - no bath towels in the bathroom, Wi-fi in the room didn't always work and the computer was also temperamental. The staff sorted out the problems quickly and efficiently, but they shouldn't be happening in the first place.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel, Great service and Ambience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: City Inn was extremely convenient to the Tate Britain. We had only one full day in London and had to see the Francis Bacon show at the Tate! We were able to walk along the Thames and see some sights as well. The Hotel is contemporary in design and very practical, really well suited for business travel. The Mac entertainment system/computer in the room was a great added bonus which worked well incorporating television, music and the internet makes great sense, and no extra fees for using it. The bed was comfortable although a bit smaller than what we are used to (a double instead of a queen/king). The bathroom was small but quite efficient. Great recommendations for dining from Guest Services for breakfast and dinners. Really a good stay! Only downside (really not much of one...) the elevator telling you everything it is doing..."closing doors, closing doors, closing doors".
reviews.title: Great dining as well

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008
reviews.text: large airy younbg hotel offers great value although my initial impression at reception not particulary friendly. A nice room but why oh why do they persist in using mac media systems instead of a good ole telly took me ages to figure it all out!
reviews.title: good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008
reviews.text: loved the selection of 'city temptations' beside the mini bar
reviews.title: Great London hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: door man and concierge staff very helpful and friendly
reviews.title: The heart of London

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed an excellent weekend in this hotel. Rooms are comfortable and well-equipped, with Apple Mac TVs and modern furnishings.Breakfasts were good, with hot food brought to the table. Staff were generally helpful and friendly. There is a great late bar and food is very good in the popular restaurant. The hotel is a little out from the West End, but handy for Tate Britain and a fifteen minute river walk to the South Bank.
reviews.title: Quite a find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Free movie rental, Unlimited internet, friendly staff, and an adaptor for my P.C. This place was great.
reviews.title: Worth it
Fabulous Hotel - "Peace in the Heart of the City"
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights during my last trip to London and couldn't have been happier with our choice. The hotel has a great convenient location and is in a very quiet street. The rooms were very clean, comfortable and modern. Having an Apple iMac computer with internet access in our room was a big plus. The restaurant uses high quality, fresh ingredients and the menu & wine list are fantastic. The breakfast buffet was very good, with a great selection to choose from. The hotel really stands out from all others in London for its levels of customer service and this made our stay so pleasurable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service- good and attentive
reviews.title: Difficult to fault

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Room-modern and very clean
reviews.title: excellent night !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location- ideal -within walking distance of many attractions
reviews.title: Great location and very clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fabuous Hotel stayed in hotels all over and have never experienced the levels of service that were demonstrated at this Hotel. Reception Guest Services and breakfast all superb.
reviews.title: Overall Nice Hotel in Quiet Area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was clean and very hip. The staff here are extremely friendly and very helpful. We were made to feel like royalty the minute we stepped out of the cab by everyone from housekeeping to restraunt waitstaff to the conceirge. This is definitely a 4-star hotel with 5+ star service.
reviews.title: Loved It!

likes.liked: — It was close to quite a few of the main attractions in London.
likes.disliked: — The view from our room was the backside of a building.

reviews.title: Return trip to City Inn - still excellent
reviews.text: We first stayed at the City Inn in June 2006, and you can read my full review if you scroll back to then :-). We chose it then from recommendations from colleagues at work, and also from Tripadvisor.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: And it is still excellent! It's still excellent value for money, and is an oasis of peace and calm in the heart of london's Westminster district. Yes, it is a little tucked away in the business district behind Millbank Tower, but this means that you get peace and quiet away from the manic-ness of the West End. but it's still only a 10 minute walk to Pimlico Station (Victoria Line) and 5 minutes down to the Thames (its almost on the side of the Thames). And if you really feel like walking its only a brisk 20 min walk to Buckingham Palace! So you have the best of both worlds - near to stuff, yet peaceful, leafy and pleasant.
reviews.title: fabulous hotel

likes.liked: — flat screen television, fab shower, comfortable bed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: The hotel itself still provides high levels of customer service, the front desk staff couldn't be more helpful! And we still like the 'City Inn' style rooms above more traditional hotel rooms (more an advert for Habitat and Ikea than dull hotel furniture!!) a fresh and modern approach that its competitors don't seem to have caught onto yet! (which is all the better for City Inn!). We tried some room service this time - i had the home made burger and it truly was a home made beef patty of a burger - huge and really really tasty! And not that overpriced for London either!
reviews.title: City Inn, Westminister, London

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's the only place we stay in London now - you are guaranteed a high level of service for the reasonable rates, and peace and quiet (yet close connections to the attractions) and you certainly get a lot more for your money than at bigger hotels who charge more in London. Keep up the good work City Inn!
reviews.title: Superb location !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: Maybe I'm a little spoiled because I stay at nice hotels in many cities, but I was a little disappointed with the City Inn when I compare it to hotels I sometimes stay in. Relative to a Holiday Inn in Kensington or Kings Cross (both of which I stayed in during the same year), it was superior and vastly superior to the latter. But, relative to the Westin in Melbourne (where I stayed last month), it is a little disappointing. My client booked rooms at the City Inn and I ran a seminar there. The staff was reasonably helpful with regard to the seminar and the food served at our dinners was very good. The rooms seemed rather small, the furniture more like IKEA than classy, I like power showers and like the jazzy style, but it lacked a little below the surface. No big complaints, just not as great as many of the reviews seem to suggest.
reviews.title: jazzy but small room with IKEA-like furnishing; a little disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed 3 nights Dec 31st to 3rd Jan 2008 and what excellent value for the New Year in London. Staff were extremely helpful and friendly and checking in was a breeze.
reviews.title: Superb value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room and bathroom was small but not too bad - it had everything we needed. Fridge had real milk and there was a good selction of quality beverages and biscuits. Iron & board and a powerful hairdryer were included as was a decent size safe. Bathroom had White Company goods and they were restocked eacjhday along with large fluffy towels.
reviews.title: Great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: There was a CD and DVD Player with complimentary use of music and film library.
reviews.title: excellent value

likes.disliked: — a bit of a walk from the nearest tube

reviews.title: State of the art hotel beside the Tate Britain Gallery
reviews.text: We booked the VIP room which was well worth the small extra fee - we got a basket of fruit on arrival, large bottle of mineral water each day, maid service twice per day, 2 newspapers and best of all 2 vouchers each day of the stay worth £9.75 each towards drinks in the Millbank Lounge - we treat ourselves to 2 nice cocktails each night before going out.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Drive around, we arrived on a sat afternoon and it was heaving, the hotel was fairly easy to find though located on the embankment just across the river from the MI5 building.
reviews.title: "Easily one of the best hotels in London"

likes.liked: — The whole feel of the place, it's design and superb and fresh room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel after reading the Trip Advisor reviews and it does not disappoint. It is a 20 minute walk past the Houses of Parliament in to the West End so it is very convenient. Got a great rate on the hotel web site. Staff are friendly and helpful. Most excellently, however, is the apple mac in the room that allows you to surf for local attractions etc.
reviews.title: Highly Recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Plus super comfy beds!
reviews.title: Clean, modern, and comfortable hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent four nights at the City Inn. The rooms were very clean and modern and the bed was quite comfortable. I liked that the Mac in the room can also be used as a television. They provided robes, wine glasses, and everything needed for afternoon tea. In addition to the Mac in the room, they also have wireless internet included in the rate of your hotel stay. I would definitely stay at this hotel again. The proximity to two nearby tube stations was good--a five or ten minute walk, and Big Ben, the Westminster Abbey, and London Eye are also nearby.
reviews.title: Great room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This is a great hotel. The room is huge compared with others I have stayed in while in London. The bed was very comfortable. In room, there is an Imac that doubles as the TV -- I thought that was pretty innovative. The only problem was learning how to use it (I am a PC guy).
reviews.title: Loved the City Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The breakfast was good and the bar was, ahem, chic. The only drawback was the distance to the nearest tube station. It is smack dab in the middle of Pimlico and Westminster.
reviews.title: Would come back to the City Inn

likes.liked: — Good standard of accommodation and helpful staff.
likes.disliked: — Location, it's a little hard to find.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I stayed in the hotel over the last Bank Holiday in May. On arrival the check in was fast and easy to use, when I enquired about where I could pay my congestion charge fee this was arranged by the concierge! All very easy so far.....
reviews.title: Bank Holiday Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My room was clean, light, no view but then as I have said on other posts I don't come to major cities to look out of my hotel window. If there is a view it’s a bonus as far as I am concerned. The bathroom was uncomfortably small, but the shower hot and with adjustable pressure. Perfect after a long drive.
reviews.title: Exceeded all expectations

likes.disliked: — The full english breakfast, (not the english version anyway!)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant was acceptable, nothing special and to be honest fairly reasonably priced in an already overpriced city.
reviews.title: another great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only complaint if you can call it that was the 'Garage' below. It is the foundation of the building and therefore has many, many support pillars that are worryingly close together which makes parking manoeuvres and leaving the garage a sweat breaking experience. The NCP car park nearby or even the street is more highly recommended!
reviews.title: Really, just another hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all a nice stay, and 3 stars is not overrating the place at all
reviews.title: Absolutley Wonderfull Experience -- Except the Food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this hotel after reading reviews on this website. I was somewhat dubious that it could be as good as described but it was. The location is excellent, it is about five minutes walk from the Houses of Parliament but the street is quiet, and tidy. This area has a mixture of apartments and government offices and is clean and safe. The hotel is literally round the back of the Tate Gallery. Check in was efficient and courteous thanks to the lovely Pilar. The hotel is modern, bright and airy and has bars, a restaurant, a fitness suite and conference facilities. The room was excellent having all the usual things as well as DVD player (the hotel has a selection of films in the concierge) and a mini hifi system. Everything in the room was very nice. Decent biscuits with the tea/ coffee making facilities as well as decent tea/ coffee. Fluffy bathrobes and nice shower gel in the bathroom (although no bath). Air conditioning and WiFi as well. Overall the room was very very nice. The breakfast was very efficient and very comprehensive. Cereal, yoghourt, fruit, smoothy, croisant, pain au chocolat, muffins, cheese, cold meat, salmon, bagels as well as cooked breakfast (including kedgeree and eggs benedict). Here again everything was very nice. The staff here are also good looking, I felt as though I were in a film. Room and breakfast for two cost £113. What a bargain. Fantastic location, great facilities, great room, great food, this has to score the full 5 marks. The staff and the hotel itself really tries hard to make you feel special, will absolutely not go anywhere else after this.
reviews.title: City Inn Westminster, what a gem.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The City Inn chain is a welcome addition to the business travel class of hotels, and this Westminster branch is has a stylish and airy feel. The room was equipped with all mod-cons and the furniture was trendy, though perhaps not the most sturdy and could easily have been supplied by IKEA! The maxim, 'you get what you pay for' seems to apply here and a more expensive room is a good choice for the extra space, but for one or two nights a standard is fine. The hotel is a little far from the tube - a good 12 minute walk - but Pimlico is a perfectly nice area and the Tate Britain and Westminster are within a short walk. Reasonable for the price, but nothing outstanding.
reviews.title: Stylish but not spacious!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked this hotel through London Town, after reading other trip advisor comments and noted this hotel ranked 4th in London. I can totally see why. I have stayed in many hotels around the world 4/5* and have become quite critical due to experience of what makes a good hotel. On check in staff were friendly informative and we were checked in promptly. The porter took our bags even though we had small cabin bags that we could have easily managed. The rooms are very modern and not everyones cup of tea as some people love traditional styles but it had all the facilities you could want. Breakfast was fantastic, proper decent laid tables, everything was served to a high standard with a great selection of top quality foods. What a pleasant change. We were also then given great advice on where to eat, 1st night an Italian called Gran Paradiso which was great, 2nd night we ate at the Gaucho Grill in Picadilly. Both excellent. The hotel is in a great location also. I really couldnt fault anything about the hotel and will be staying here again soon when i want a night out in London. It beats other hotels by a mile.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

likes.disliked: — Looks like it has all come from Ikea - Cheap

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just had to write a review to say what a lovely time we had in London this weekend - and our Hotel was just in the perfect location. The reception staff were so nice at check-in - they tried to upgrade us but the hotel was so busy this weekend that we had to settle for the standard room. The rooms were spotlessly clean and had absolutely eveything you would need for a weekend stay - great White Co toileteries, iron and ironing board, hairdryer, power shower, TV and CD player, 24 hour room service.
reviews.title: Great stay at City Inn Westminster

likes.liked: — Perfect location, all amenities you would need
likes.disliked: — No view from the back rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007
reviews.text: We had a drink in the bar one of the nights and again, the staff were lovely. Didn't bother having breakfast there (queues looked long!). I have recommended this hotel to my brother-in-law and his wife who plan a trip to London in the next few weeks. I don't think the hotel can be beaten within its class for price, location and accomodation. Can't wait to go back!
reviews.title: Very classy - great experience

likes.liked: — The very attentive staff made you feel so welcome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: Stayed here for a weekend, end of september 2008. This is really a great hotel, excellent staff, nice room, good bed.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: The room has all the usual things like minibar, waterboiler (hidden in a drawer, I first didn't think they had any), iron. Instead of the TV they have an Imac computer. Free and easy internet access, DVD's can be borrowed for free, small selection, but still. I brought some movies on a thumbdrive, I plugged it in and it worked without problems. This is really a great service!
reviews.title: What a FANTASTIC Hotel - Everything Perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: The breakfast is really good! I had english breakfast prepaid, but there is the usual selection of yogurt, cereals and bread too. Fresh fruit and orangejuice, nice.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They have a cafe and restaurant too, but I didn't try them.
reviews.title: Great 7 Night Stay at The City Inn

likes.liked: — Imac Computer, comfortable bed, Breakfast and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only negative I can say about this hotel is the prices for the room service, it's expensive.
reviews.title: Good night had

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I went to London last weekend for a weekend getaway. After several weeks of reading reviews, I decided to stay at this hotel. My time spent reading reviews was definately not wasted on this hotel.
reviews.title: The Best Hotel I Have Ever Stayed At

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: We booked our stay directly from the hotel's website. We booked a club room and were guarenteed early arrival. When we arrived at 9am our room was not yet ready. They told us that they would have a room ready very soon for us and gave us a full complimentary breakfast while we waited. This made for an awesome first impression.
reviews.title: What a great hotel

likes.liked: — Good location, great staff, fab food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The rooms were rather roomy for a European hotel. While the bathroom was rather small compared to many hotels I've stayed at, it was large for a European hotel and still roomy enough for 2 people to get ready in.
reviews.title: What a great hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: The restaraunt is very good. We had room service both nights. While the 4 pound tray charge per room seemed a little steep, I think all prices in London are somewhat steep.
reviews.title: Love, love, love this hotel

likes.disliked: — The price, but it's well worth it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled solo
reviews.text: The hotel staff was very kind during our entire stay. When we checked out of the hotel, we took a cab to the train station. Unfortunately I left my purse in the cab which contained our passports and credit cards. This is a very scary situation. We went back to the hotel and they were more than helpful in trying to help us figure out what we needed to do. They assisted us in getting the cabs license plate number, contacting the police stations, and the embassy. Unfortunately it was a bank holiday on the day we were leaving so nothing was open. There was room in the hotel for another night and they were willing to help us get reservations. Luckily, the cabbie that drove us to the train station frequents the hotel and returned to the hotel. My purse was in the back of the cab and untouched by anyone. We were extremely lucky.
reviews.title: Very Trendy

likes.liked: — The added Extras in the room and also how modern it was

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: stayed here to bring in the new year. First time in London for new year and booked the new years eve package. I upgraded room to a suite which had a great view and a lovely size bathroom. Very clean and could not hear the lift so got a great night sleep especially as the bed was hudge and soft.
reviews.title: good location, shame about the food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best thing about this place is the bar. The bar men take special pride in there job, watching them make my cocktails was very pleasing, especially the italian guy as he has huge passion which is lacking in most london bars, it started my night off lovely.
reviews.title: perfect hotel in central london

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My problems with my stay was that the new years eve buffet was extremely poor. Most of the dishes were bland except for the beef wellington which was ok. We had to wait around for ages before they bought cutlery to serve us the vegtables so the beef wellington layed cold on our plates while we waited in line. Very disapointing. Also the puddings were adverage. Would have been better to had stayed at home and got in some marks food. We also went up to the sky bar, which had great views and lots of champagne but the canapes were very salty and were brought round by waiters not very often and there was not enough to offer people. Very bad, shame on you city inn for being tight.
reviews.title: Loved it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are extremely friendly but check your bill when you check out. They tried to over charge us for the amount of £40. The Lady that checked us out also short changed us for £10 which we only realised once we were home.
reviews.title: Advice from a seasoned guest

likes.liked: — Quality of design, fittings, fixtures and location.
likes.disliked: — The majority of staff are unable to understand English fluently.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Really loved this hotel, after a bad experience in london a few years ago was this a very good one.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

description: The DoubleTree by Hilton London – Westminster is as close to a cultural epicentre as it is possible to get. The Houses of Parliament, Westminster Abbey and Tate Britain are just a short walk away, while the West End, financial institutions & the ‘Square Mile’ in the City, South Bank and the London Eye are also within easy reach. Our own attractions are impressive, too: Enjoy innovative, modern-European cuisine at our Award-Winning City Café offers fresh, seasonal, imaginative menus and a separate terrace for stylish al fresco dining. Enjoy a drink and more at the informal-but-stylish atmosphere of Millbank Lounge, and the on-top-of-the-world feeling of the Skylounge for a rendezvous with a view. Airy, modern rooms offer all the comforts you’d expect – and some you might not, like an Apple iMac and complimentary high-speed internet in every room and throughout the hotel. The Hotel was designed with original touches we know our guests appreciate: a fresh, light contemporary design; floor-to-ceiling windows; enhanced fresh air conditioning & soundproofing for undisturbed nights. We also offer late night room service, state-of-the-art meeting facilities and private dining rooms. So whether you’re on business or enjoying a relaxing break, DoubleTree by Hilton London – Westminster has what it takes to make your stay a memorable one.
